title: Breaking News, Latest News and Current Affairs
text:
Recipes: Delicious Diwali delights! Whether we are craving some Burfis, or the simple, healthy yet delicious Diwali Mixtures (Chiwda), there are multiple dishes that only require a little time and a lot of dedication.

Gujarat-based firm wins bid for Parliament revamp Gujarat-based architecture firm HCP Designs has won the consultancy bid for the Centre's ambitious project to redevelop the Central Vista, including Parliament and Rajpath, and develop a Common Central Secretariat for various ministries, Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri said on Friday.

Raut posts toon taking a dig at alliance partner The cartoon, posted by Raut on his verified Twitter account, shows a tiger (Shiv Senas party symbol) wearing a clock locket (NCPs party symbol) sniffing a lotus (BJPs party symbol). While the post is captioned "bura na maano Diwali hai" to denote it was made in jest, the underlying message echoes what former CM Prithviraj Chavan sought to convey about the Sena, NCP and Congress coming together to prevent BJP from retaining power in Maharashtra.

Fake: Pankaja Munde 'cried' after poll loss A photo of Maharashtra BJP leader Pankaja Munde that makes it looks like she was crying is being shared by many social media users with a claim that she broke down after she lost Parli seat to her cousin.

Mamata jogs 10km in Darjeeling hills West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee went on a 10-km jog along with senior bureaucrats, police officers and local TMC workers in the hill town of Kurseong in Darjeeling district to raise awareness about environment conservation. With some of those in her entourage visibly looking tired during the uphill jog, the CM chose to walk some part of the distance.

SBI net profit rises 30% to Rs 3,012 crore in Q2 The country's largest lender State Bank of India on Friday reported a standalone net profit of Rs 3,011.73 crore for the quarter ended September 30, up 30.25% as compared to net profit of Rs 2,312.20 crore posted in the previous quarter. Net NPAs or bad loans too declined to 2.79 per cent of the advances from 4.84 per cent in the year-ago period.

Maharashtra polls: How turncoats fared MUMBAI: It is a mixed bag of results for turncoats in Maharashtra polls. While Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil and Nitesh Rane who dumped the Congress for the BJP emerged victorious, Harshvardhan Patil lost. There were about 20 turncoats in the fray for the assembly election. Here's a look at some key winners and losers.

Old warhorse Sharad Pawar breathes life into NCP Sharad Pawar has fought serious odds and breathed fresh oxygen not only into his party, the Nationalist Congress Party, but into almost all regional parties in the country. The dominant Maratha community in western Maharashtra found greater appeal in the ageing Pawar’s energetic rallies than in BJP’s reservation pie.

IndiGo A320 Neo returns after P&W engine stalls In yet another case of Pratt & Whitney (PW) engine stall on the Airbus A320 Neo and high vibration, an IndiGo flight returned to Mumbai minutes after taking off for Coimbatore on Friday. Since twin-engine aircraft can land safely on one engine, the Neo (VT-ITA) also did so by returning to the origin.

In touch with 15 rebels, says Fadnavis The BJP-Shiv Sena alliance fell considerably short of the target of winning more than 220 seats in the Maharashtra assembly elections. The combined tally stood at 161. Sharad Pawar’s NCP was chiefly responsible for slowing the saffron march — winning 54 seats as against just 41 in 2014. BJP score dropped from 122 in the 2014 polls to 105 and Sena’s from 63 to 56.

Article 370 appeal fails to click with voters Abrogation of Article 370 was the focus of PM Modi's belligerent election campaign in Haryana and Maharashtra. Taking the cue, BJP candidates often began their speeches chanting ‘Bharat Ki Mata Jai’ and hailing the government’s “bold and decisive” move in J&K. But politicians & social scientists say that it hasn’t worked, at least to the extent that BJP wanted.

Infosys case: US mkt regulator to seek Sebi's coop US market regulator SEC will be seeking cooperation from its Indian counterpart Sebi in its probe into Infosys, which has been rocked by whistleblower complaints of several alleged irregularities, sources said on Friday.

How Maha, Haryana results can hurt BJP in J'khand The results of Maharashtra and Haryana assembly elections should make BJP worry about its prospects in Jharkhand. The reason for BJP’s worry may originate from the fact that Jharkhand shares some common political situations with Maharashtra and Haryana which went to polls on October 21. Raghubar Das, a non-tribal, is the CM in a tribal-dominated state.

Poster calling Aaditya as Maha CM comes up A poster calling Aaditya Thackeray as future CM came up in Worli, the constituency from which he has been elected in Maharashtra elections. Aaditya Thackeray, the 29-year-old son of Uddhav Thackeray won from Mumbai's Worli constituency, is the 1st member of the family in the Shiv Sena's history to contest the election.

Sena's dig at BJP: 'Results a rap on knuckles' A day after the poll results in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena on Friday took a dig at BJP, saying there was no "maha janadesh" and the outcome was in fact a rap on the knuckles for those high on "arrogance of power". In its mouthpiece "Saamana", Sena said the mandate has rejected the notion that elections can be swept by engineering defections & splitting opposition parties.
description: Latest News and Live News on Politics, Current affairs. Breaking news on Business, Sports, Bollywood, technology, science & health. Times of India Covers all latest & breaking news across India and world.
